Actor Dileep

KOCHI: The Ernakulam principal sessions court will pronounce the verdict in the sensational actor abduction and rape case, in which actor Dileep is accused of conspiring and hiring a gang to execute the crime, on Monday.District and sessions judge Honey M Varghese will deliver the judgment against 10 accused, excluding those who were discharged or turned approver during the trial. Sunil N S alias Pulsar Suni, who led the gang that abducted and raped the actor, is the prime accused.Besides Suni and Dileep, the accused include Martin Antony, Manikandan B, Vijeesh V P, Salim H alias Vadival Salim, Pradeep, Charly Thomas, Sanilkumar alias Mesthiri Sanil, and G Sarath. The offences include those under Sections 120(A), 120(B) (criminal conspiracy), 109 (abetment of crime), 342, 357 (wrongful confinement), 366 (kidnapping), 354 (outraging a woman's modesty), 354(B) (intent to disrobe a woman), 376(D) (gang rape), 506(i) (criminal intimidation), 201 (destroying evidence), 212 (harbouring an offender), and 34 (common intention) of the IPC.The popular actor was abducted and assaulted in Kochi on Feb 17, 2017, when she was travelling from Thrissur to Kochi.The prosecution's case is that the gang hijacked the survivor's vehicle. Martin Antony was entrusted with picking up the survivor from her house, and he informed Suni of her location throughout the journey. Suni and others started following the vehicle from Angamaly and faked an accident at Athani at 9.15pm. The accused then entered the vehicle and wrongfully confined her. Suni threatened the survivor, sexually assaulted her and recorded obscene videos, including the visuals of the sexual assault, on a mobile phone.In Nov 2022, police relied on circumstantial evidence to submit a second chargesheet that actor Dileep conspired with Suni. It was alleged that Dileep nursed a grudge towards the survivor for informing his former wife, actor Manju Warrier, about his extramarital affair.The trial in the case began on March 8, 2018. Over the years, it saw 261 witnesses, including prominent film actors, being examined in camera, with 28 of them turning hostile. Two prosecutors resigned over the years, and the survivor unsuccessfully moved higher courts seeking to change the presiding officer. Ultimately, the prosecution submitted 833 documents and 142 pieces of evidence, while the defence submitted 221 documents. The witness examination alone took 438 days.
Article Summary: The Ernakulam principal sessions court will pronounce the verdict in the sensational actor abduction and rape case on Monday. The popular actor was abducted and assaulted in Kochi on Feb 17, 2017, when she was travelling from Thrissur to Kochi. The trial in the case began on March 8, 2018.

Article Title: Indigo fiasco: Airline chaos abates in Bengaluru, but baggage nightmare persists for passengers
Article Text:
Aviation Meltdown Escalates As IndiGo Cancels 400 Flights And Government Enforces Fare Controls

BENGALURU: The chaos at Kempegowda International Airport (KIA) may have eased Friday night, but for hundreds of stranded passengers, the ordeal continued. Even as IndiGo continued to cancel flights, passengers spent up to 10 agonising hours sifting through piles of abandoned baggage — some damaged, some missing — as assurances of refunds did little to alleviate the stress caused by a system that collapsed without warning.Dhanya Ravindhran, whose flight was cancelled, waited over eight hours for her baggage and camera gear needed for a shoot. "I kept asking the IndiGo staff, but they had no idea how to retrieve it. They simply said, ‘Madam, please wait' for hours," she said. "Finally, with the help of an airport staff member, I found a small opening near the conveyor tunnel and pulled out my luggage myself. There were heaps of bags dumped there — easily over 1,000," she told TOI.Similarly, Arif Khan, a software engineer travelling to Jaipur, found his suitcase damaged after a seven-hour wait. "My bag looked like it had been thrown around. The wheels were broken, and no staff member could explain what happened...This is the worst situation for IndiGo in the history of its operations."For 24-year-old student Anjana Ram, the long wait escalated into panic. "I had medications in my checked-in bag.I waited almost nine hours and pleaded with the staff to prioritise it, but they said they weren't able to track individual bags," she said. When her luggage finally arrived, the zipper had been split open. "Things were falling out. It was heartbreaking."UK-bound traveller Prakash Menon described the scene as "an ocean of abandoned bags". He added, "People were climbing over piles to find their luggage. There was no system, no announcements, no queue management. It was unbelievable for an international airport of this scale."Even as crowds diminished by evening, travellers said the airport must urgently improve baggage retrieval procedures to prevent a repeat of this week-long disruption. "Refunds don't fix the mental stress or the damaged luggage," Menon said. "The system clearly wasn't prepared for a crisis of this magnitude."Singer takes ordeal to social mediaFor Bengaluru-based singer Ananya Prakash, what should have been a short flight to Hyderabad turned into an ordeal she will never forget. Her flight was abruptly cancelled, leaving her and hundreds of others stranded with no clarity. "The airlines are least bothered about passengers," she said, standing amid a sea of confused travellers. "People have been waiting for hours. There's no space to even sit."Her checked-in baggage only added to the distress. At first, airline staff told her the bags would be delayed. Then the message changed: it could take two days to get them back."I had all my work equipment in that bag," she said. As the chaos grew, Prakash took to social media, pleading for answers and highlighting the airline's indifference.
Article Summary: Passengers spent up to 10 agonising hours sifting through piles of abandoned baggage. Travellers said the airport must urgently improve baggage retrieval procedures. "Refunds don't fix the mental stress or the damaged luggage," Prakash Menon said.

Article Title: Goa Fire: A Sholay song, music, dance: Goa nightclub in full party mode, then deadly fire kills 25
Article Text:
Goa: 23 Killed In Arpora Nightclub Fire; Cylinder Blast Suspected, CM Sawant Vows Strict Action

GOA: At least 25 people were killed and fifty others were injured in a fire that engulfed the popular nightclub in Arpora, north Goa, late on Saturday night.The fire broke out when around several tourists were on the dance floor. A video from the club shows a dancer performing to the Sholay song 'Mehbooba o Mehbooba' as flames suddenly appear behind the console.Staff rushed to remove equipment, but the fire spread quickly.Witnesses described chaos as the blaze engulfed the ceiling and temporary palm leaf décor, trapping several people in the kitchen area.Also Read | Dance floor turns deadly: 25 die as cylinder blast triggers panic at nightclub in North Goa; what we know so far Most of the victims were staff members, including three women and 4 tourists were also among the dead. Authorities said most deaths were due to suffocation.“Suddenly, there was a fire. We rushed out of the club only to see the entire structure up in flames,” said Fatima Shaikh, a tourist from Hyderabad. Other visitors narrowly avoided the disaster, with some arriving just as smoke began rising.Access to the club was difficult for emergency services, as it is located along narrow lanes by the Arpora backwaters. Firefighters had to park tankers nearly 400 metres away, slowing the response.Goa Police chief Alok Kumar told PTI that the blaze was believed to have been triggered by a cylinder explosion. The club, which opened last year, is located around 25 km from the state capital, Panaji.Also Read | 'Kitchen was dead end': Fire erupted on dance floor; witnesses recall night of horror at jam-packed North Goa club “A total of 25 people have died, including four confirmed tourists and 14 staff members, while the identities of seven are yet to be established. Six others are injured and undergoing treatment,” Kumar said.Goa chief minister Pramod Sawant visited the site and said the nightclub had not complied with fire safety norms. An inquiry has been ordered, and the management, as well as officials who permitted the club to operate, will face consequences.Local panchayat officials said the club was constructed without valid permissions. “We had inspected the premises and found that they did not have the permission to construct the club,” said Arpora-Nagoa sarpanch Roshan Redkar. A demolition notice had previously been issued but stayed by higher authorities.Calangute MLA Michael Lobo announced that all nightclubs in the area would undergo fire safety audits from Monday. Licenses of clubs without proper permissions will be cancelled.
Article Summary: At least 25 people were killed and fifty others were injured in a fire that engulfed the popular nightclub in Arpora, north Goa. The fire broke out when around several tourists were on the dance floor. Most of the victims were staff members, including three women and 4 tourists were also among the dead.

Article Title: IndiGo flight chaos: MLAs travel 12 hours by rail, road to reach Nagpur for assembly session; govt arranged special trains
Article Text:
Aviation Meltdown Escalates As IndiGo Cancels 400 Flights And Government Enforces Fare Controls

NAGPUR: Amid mass cancellations of IndiGo flights, chairperson of the Maharashtra Legislative Council, Ram Shinde, on Sunday said special trains will be operated from Nagpur to Mumbai on December 14 and 15 to facilitate the return of MLAs, ministers, officers, and staff after the conclusion of the winter session, which will be held in Nagpur from December 8 to 14.Speaking to the media about the arrangements in Vidhan Bhavan, Shinde said several elected representatives faced difficulty securing flights to reach Nagpur, raising concern over their travel back to Mumbai."To avoid inconvenience, the state govt requested the Railways to arrange special trains, and the appeal has been accepted. A nodal officer has been appointed to coordinate communication with all legislators for seamless travel arrangements," Shinde said adding that the administration has been instructed to monitor and respond to travel-related concerns throughout the session actively.On appointment of leader of opposition (LoP) in both Houses, Shinde said they received a proposal and will take a decision only after further deliberation. On Sunday, opposition parties boycotted the CM's customary tea party on the session's even over vacant posts of LoP in both Houses.Reacting to rumours that the winter session may not happen in Nagpur due to expansion work of the Vidhan Bhavan complex, both Shinde and deputy chairperson Neelam Gorhe said the city will continue to host the session.Shinde also said that matters concerning Vidarbha will receive top priority in the upcoming legislative business, including during the Question Hour. On concerns over the short 8-day session, Shinde said as presiding officer, he will strive to facilitate meaningful debate on regional concerns.Following the review meeting, Shinde and Gorhe inspected both Houses and related facilities to ensure operational readiness for the seesion.
Article Summary: Special trains will be operated from Nagpur to Mumbai on December 14 and 15. The winter session will be held in Nagpur from December 8 to 14. Opposition parties boycotted the CM's customary tea party on the session's even over vacant posts of LoP.

Article Title: Goa Nightclub Fire Accident: Viral video shows crowd grooving to Sholay's 'Mehbooba’ as flames erupt in background
Article Text:
Also Read |

Crowd Grooving To ‘Mehbooba’ As Flames Engulf Goa Nightclub, Video Goes Viral

Also Read |

Also Read |

ARPORA: A massive fire at the popular Arpora nightclub Birch in North Goa late Saturday killed 25 people, including five tourists, and injured six. Flames erupted around 11.45pm during a belly-dance performance and engulfed the first-floor dance floor within seconds.Around 150 people were in the DJ area when the blaze broke out, with the dancer performing to Mehbooba O Mehbooba when the fire was first noticed.Electric firecrackers are believed to have struck the wooden ceiling, igniting the blaze. Smoke quickly filled the building, triggering panic. Some guests fled downstairs to the basement kitchen, where 23 victims suffocated. Two charred bodies were later found on the staircase.The deceased included 20 staffers from Assam, Bengal, Maharashtra, Uttarakhand, Uttar Pradesh, Jharkhand, and Nepal, alongside five tourists. The club, located on a salt pan and surrounded by water, had only a narrow access lane, which trapped revellers and delayed rescue efforts. Investigations revealed the nightclub was operating without proper licences and flouted fire safety norms. Three state government officials have been suspended.Chief minister Pramod Sawant said the chief secretary and DGP Alok Kumar would initiate disciplinary action against the suspended officials. He dismissed initial speculation of a cylinder blast, noting that police and fire service investigations pointed to electric firecrackers as the cause. “The fire spread quickly because of the wooden ceiling,” he said.Postmortems on 17 bodies were completed by Saturday evening, and five were handed over to families. Following the inquiry, the state government sealed Romeo Lane at Vagator, another club owned by the same proprietors, citing inadequate fire safety measures.Police arrested four club staffers—chief general manager Rajiv Modak, gate manager Priyanshu Thakur, bar manager Rajveer Singhania, and general manager Vivek Singh. An FIR has been registered against Delhi-based owners Saurabh and Gaurav Luthra for culpable homicide not amounting to murder. A police team is in Delhi to serve arrest warrants.Prime Minister Narendra Modi announced Rs 2 lakh ex gratia for the next of kin of each deceased and Rs 50,000 for the injured. CM Sawant separately declared Rs 5 lakh for each death and Rs 50,000 to the injured.DGP Alok Kumar said the fire spread rapidly from the first-floor ceiling, trapping guests in the basement. The incident has raised urgent questions about fire safety standards at Goa’s after-hours clubs.
Article Summary: Flames erupted around 11.45pm during a belly-dance performance and engulfed the first-floor dance floor within seconds. The deceased included 20 staffers from Assam, Bengal, Maharashtra, Uttarakhand, Uttar Pradesh, Jharkhand, and Nepal, alongside five tourists.

Article Title: ‘Rs 500cr suitcase makes a CM’: Navjot Singh Sidhu wife’s claim sparks firestorm
Article Text: Chandigarh: Former Punjab Congress chief Navjot Singh Sidhu 's wife, Navjot Kaur Sidhu , has stirred a controversy by claiming that only a politician who gives Rs 500 crore in a suitcase becomes the chief minister in Punjab — an apparent dig at alleged corruption in her party.Navjot Kaur's remark came on Saturday evening, when she was speaking to media after meeting Punjab governor Gulab Chand Kataria on deteriorating law and order in the state. She claimed that her husband could bring a turnaround in Punjab if any party empowered him, but they did not have the money to give donations to any party. When asked by a journalist why did she mention the money, she responded, "Nahi. Hamse kisi ne nahi ki demand, par CM wahi banta hai jo 500 crore da attache deta hai (No one asked us for money, but only a person who gives a suitcase full of Rs 500 crore becomes the CM). "Reacting to the remarks, Congress MP and former Punjab deputy chief minister Sukhjinder Singh Randhawa on Sunday mentioned the Congress made Sidhu a minister and state president. "I want to ask how much money did he give and to whom for that? The status of party president is higher than that of the CM. Levelling such allegations when you have served as party president is anti-party. The high command should look into it," he said.Randhawa added the Sidhus hadn't been active for four years, but started levelling allegations when elections were near. "They have always betrayed the party. He (Sidhu) refused to make an address during a party rally attended by Priyanka Gandhi in Dhuri [in the run-up to 2022 Punjab elections after Channi was announced as CM candidate by the Congress]," he added.On Saturday, Navjot Kaur also blamed infighting with Punjab Congress for her husband staying away. "Vo Congress ke saath attached hain, bahut zyada Priyanka ji ke saath attachment hai. Par mujhe itni infighting mein lag nahi raha ki kahin bhi Navjot Sidhu ko ye promote hone denge. Kyonki paanch-paanch CM already bane hue hai aur vo haraane pe lage hue hain Congress ko. Aur agar unko samajh aa jaye to baat doosri hai (He is attached to the Congress, and deeply to Priyanka. But, given the scale of infighting in Punjab Congress, I don't feel they will let Navjot Sidhu be promoted. Because, there are five CMs (read aspirants) already and they are bent upon defeating the Congress. It is another matter if the high command understands)," she said.Randhawa asked Navjot Kaur if this meant that each of these five CM aspirants would give the party Rs 2,500 crore.AAP slams congThe incumbent Aam Aadmi Party (AAP) also latched onto the statement to criticise Congress. Punjab AAP spokesperson and former minister Kuldeep Singh Dhaliwal, while speaking to the media in Amritsar and referring to Navjot Kaur's remarks, said it exposed the "internal reality of Congress". "Five people are roaming around Punjab claiming to be chief ministerial faces of Congress. This is the reason the party has been ruined," he said.In Chandigarh, AAP Punjab general secretary and media in-charge Baltej Pannu said the statement had "exposed the ugly truth of how Congress functions, how leadership is decided, and how Punjab's interests are sidelined for personal ambitions and monetary deals". "Navjot Kaur Sidhu made two explosive claims, Navjot Sidhu will re-enter Punjab politics only if Congress first declares him as the CM face and the Sidhus do not have Rs 500 crore to play, implying that becoming CM in Punjab requires a Rs 500 crore deal," he said.Pannu called the remarks "deeply disturbing"."Does the Congress actually sell the CM face for Rs 500 crore? If Sidhus claim they don't have Rs 500 crore, who pays this amount? Where does this money go? To the state unit president? To high command? To Rahul Gandhi or Kharge? The people of Punjab deserve answers," he said.Dacoits sitting in party: JakharPunjab BJP president Sunil Jakhar, who preceded Sidhu as Punjab Congress president, said, "I heard from the horse's mouth, or you may say son of the horse, who said they got the chief ministership for Rs 350 crore. See where the Congress has reached."Asserting that he did not have the audio proof of the Rs 350-crore claim and that "Madam Sidhu may have one for Rs 500 crore", Jakhar said he did have a "tweet" of a Congress leader where he said "dacoits have been made to sit in Congress". "Those dacoits are still there. The dacoits I am talking about are still holding positions of power in Congress. Those who take the test that such a person cannot become the chief minister of Punjab, that biba ji (woman) is still sitting there. Those who took 300 or 500 (cr) or whatever are still sitting there," he said.
Article Summary: Navjot Kaur Sidhu's remark came on Saturday evening, when she was speaking to media after meeting Punjab governor Gulab Chand Kataria. She claimed that her husband could bring a turnaround in Punjab if any party empowered him, but they did not have money to give donations to any party.

Article Title: Ghaziabad Jeweller Murder: Killed in 60 seconds, Ghaziabad jeweller stabbed to death during robbery; accused watched 25 YouTube ‘heist tutorials’
Article Text: GHAZIABAD: A 75-year-old jewellery shop owner in Modinagar was stabbed to death on Thursday morning during a robbery in Govindpuri. CCTV footage, retrieved by police, shows the victim seated at the counter when a man wearing a monkey cap enters, throws red chilli powder in his face, then climbs onto the counter and stabs him more than 10 times. The assailant was caught by local residents after a brief chase, about 30 metres from the shop, and later detained by police.The incident occurred shortly after 8.30 am, when the victim, Girdhari Lal, had opened his shop, Girdhari Lal & Sons Jewellery, on the ground floor of his residence. Locals said Lal, a long-time resident of Govindpuri colony, typically opened his store earlier than others in the area, a routine the assailant, Ankit Gupta, allegedly knew.A bike taxi rider living in the same area until his family relocated a month ago, Gupta was allegedly under financial stress after losing around Rs 20 lakh in shares and online gaming, police said. He knew that Lal owned three other jewellery shops and was well off. For a week, he recced Lal's Govindpuri shop and timed his attack to coincide with the early opening hours to take advantage of the lack of customers and other shopkeepers in the vicinity, police said.On Thursday, the accused entered the shop just after Lal began his day. He threw a fistful of red chilli powder into Lal's face. And even before Lal could react, Gupta climbed onto the shop's counter and slashed and stabbed him repeatedly with a knife, leaving him dead within seconds.Lal's son, Rupendra Soni, heard his father's screams and rushed into the shop, and tried to restrain the attacker. Soni hurled the assailant on a bench, but Soni pulled out what appeared to be a gun—a later investigation revealed it was a toy—and managed to give him a slip.As Soni chased him, local shopkeepers, responding to the commotion, captured the assailant roughly 25-30 metres from the shop. He was beaten by the crowd before being handed over to the police.The entire assault that lasted fewer than 60 seconds was captured in a CCTV camera installed in the shop. Police said they were analysing CCTV footage and gathering witness accounts to reconstruct the events in full.ACP Modinagar Amit Saxena said preliminary investigations indicated that Gupta targeted Lal's shop with the intention to steal jewellery. "He had planned the robbery around a week in advance. After attacking Lal, he had planned to grab the jewellery on display in a bag that he was carrying. It seems he hadn't anticipated that Soni or anyone would arrive so quickly," the officer said, adding that a toy gun had been recovered from Gupta.DCP (Rural) Surendra Nath Tiwari said Gupta has been detained and is being questioned. While no FIR was lodged till the filing of the report, police said the process of registering one was on.Police said the accused had bought the knife online and received it only on Wednesday. In the five days leading up to the crime, Gupta allegedly watched more than 25 heist videos on YouTube to prepare for the robbery, cops added. He also claimed to own a YouTube channel, Desire Telefilms, that has 6,25,000 subscribers.The attack sparked outrage among local residents and shopkeepers, many of whom shut down shops in protest, accusing the police of failing to maintain law and order. Sudheer Singh, a local shopkeeper, said, "The police chowki is just 200m away, yet patrolling is rare. A robbery attempt at Lal's shop happened two years ago, and the culprits were never caught. Even recent thefts in nearby shops are unresolved."DCP Tiwari assured the community that additional police forces had been deployed and that security measures in the area would be reviewed. He confirmed that a dedicated team would remain stationed in the market to prevent future incidents and increase patrolling in the area.
Article Summary: A 75-year-old jewellery shop owner was stabbed to death on Thursday morning during a robbery in Govindpuri. CCTV footage shows the victim seated at the counter when a man wearing a monkey cap enters, throws red chilli powder in his face, then climbs onto the counter and stabs him more than 10 times. The assailant was caught by local residents after a brief chase, about 30 metres from the shop, and later detained by police.

Article Title: Bengaluru teacher arrested for slapping student, stalls his return home; leaves boy with swollen face
Article Text: BENGALURU: A physical training (PT) teacher at a private school has landed in trouble for allegedly assaulting a 12-year-old student of Class 7. The 30-year-old teacher was arrested on Dec 4 and released on bail the same day.The student was not allowed to go home until 5.30pm after his teacher slapped him in the staff room, causing swelling on his face, his father stated in his complaint to Hulimavu police. The boy, a resident of Doddakammanahalli, is the son of a businessman. The male teacher allegedly slapped the student in front of other teachers for a mistake in the afternoon.The boy’s parents rushed to the school when their son didn’t return home ontime, and subsequently took him to a nearby hospital.A case was registered under the Juvenile Justice (Care and Protection of Children) Act and BNS Section 115 (voluntarily causing hurt).A senior police officer said the boy was known for behaving mischievously and putting other students at risk. He used to pull the chairs of other students when they were about to sit, causing them to fall. Many of his fellow students had reported the boy to the teachers for his misbehaviour.“The teacher didn’t allow the boy to go home as the principal suggested sending him home after the swelling on his face decreased. We arrested the teacher on the same day, and the court granted him bail,” added the officer.
Article Summary: The 30-year-old teacher was arrested on Dec 4 and released on bail the same day. The boy, a resident of Doddakammanahalli, is the son of a businessman. The male teacher allegedly slapped the student in front of other teachers for a mistake.

Article Title: Who is Elias Gordon Farley? Florida teacher accused of grooming student on Google Docs, sexual assault
Article Text: A science teacher at Donna Klein Jewish Academy in Boca Raton, Palm Beach County, Florida, was arrested after investigators said he used a shared Google Doc to communicate secretly with a student before engaging in sexual acts with her at the school and in his flat, according to an arrest affidavit.Elias Gordon Farley, 26, was taken into custody after the student reported the alleged abuse on November 18, Fox News reported.Farley is charged with unlawful sexual activity with a minor and offence against a student by an authority figure. He was booked into the Palm Beach County Main Detention Centre on Dec. 4 and is being held on a $500,000 bond.According to the affidavit, the student told detectives the interactions began as casual conversations during the previous school year but that over the summer Farley created a shared Google Doc in which they exchanged messages. Investigators said the file later contained explicit entries describing sexual activity and planning when they would meet privately.The student said the relationship became physical in mid-September inside Farley’s office, where he touched her beneath her clothing. She told detectives the encounters continued for weeks in both his office and a classroom. By late September and into October, she said the pair engaged in sexual acts, including oral sex and intercourse inside a classroom on campus.She also described visiting Farley’s flat twice in early November after recognising details he had mentioned about its location and layout. Deputies said several sexual encounters occurred during those visits.Detectives executed a search warrant and found bedding, condom wrappers and furniture matching the student’s description. Farley’s flatmate confirmed he had not been home on the dates the student said she visited. School surveillance video reviewed by deputies showed Farley and the student entering his office together on Nov. 7 and later entering a classroom for about an hour.The situation came to light after the student confided in an art teacher on Nov. 14 and showed bruises and bite marks she said were inflicted by Farley. Administrators were informed the next day, suspended Farley immediately and reported the matter to child welfare authorities.Farley refused to speak with detectives after being read his Miranda rights, according to the affidavit.In a statement provided to Fox News Digital, Donna Klein Jewish Academy said it is cooperating fully with the investigation and called the situation “a difficult time for all of us at Donna Klein.”“We are approaching this serious situation with the utmost care, keeping the well-being of our students, faculty and families at the forefront,” a spokesperson said. The spokesperson said no additional details would be released “out of respect for the privacy of our community” but that Farley is no longer employed at the school.
Article Summary: Elias Gordon Farley, 26, was taken into custody after the student reported the alleged abuse on November 18. He is charged with unlawful sexual activity with a minor and offence against a student by an authority figure. The student told detectives the interactions began as casual conversations during the previous school year but that over the summer Farley created a shared Google Doc.

Article Title: Goa Nightclub Manager Arrested: Manager Bharat held from Delhi; Luthra brothers still absconding
Article Text:
Saurabh Luthra

Crowd Grooving To ‘Mehbooba’ As Flames Engulf Goa Nightclub, Video Goes Viral

Owner still absconding

Saurabh Luthra

NEW DELHI: Police on Monday detained another manager linked to the tragic Birch by Romeo Lane nightclub fire in Goa that claimed 25 lives.The accused was identified as Bharat. According to police, he used to run daily operation of Birch by Romeo Lane at the club.The owner of Birch by Romeo Lane, Saurabh Luthra, remains absconding following the devastating fire at his Arpora nightclub on Saturday night, which claimed 25 lives and injured six others.Until last year, Luthra had aimed to launch 50 restaurants across India, but his weekend property turned into the site of one of Goa’s worst nightlife tragedies.Luthra’s LinkedIn profile lists him as ‘Chairman at Romeo Lane, Birch and Mama’s Buoi’. Activist Tahir Noronha described him as “like a ghost,” saying he rarely stays in Goa and often avoids legal proceedings, sending representatives in his place.“He is out of touch with the impact of his ventures,” Noronha said. Socialites and staff also described him as aloof; Jayesh Diukar, a kitchen staffer who survived the fire, said Luthra visited the club only once a month and rarely interacted with employees.At least 100-200 persons were on the dance floor of a nightclub in North Goa when a fire broke out there, and in an attempt to escape, some of them ran downstairs to its kitchen where they got trapped along with the staff.While the state police said the blaze occurred at the nightclub due to a cylinder blast after midnight on Sunday, some of the eyewitnesses claimed the fire started on the club's first floor, where tourists were dancing.Most of the dead were the club's kitchen workers, and included three women, chief minister Pramod Sawant said. There were “three to four tourists” among those killed, he added."There was a sudden commotion as the flames started erupting. We rushed out of the club only to see that the entire structure was up in flames," Fatima Shaikh, a tourist from Hyderabad, told PTI at Arpora in the wee hours of Sunday.
Article Summary: The owner of Birch by Romeo Lane, Saurabh Luthra, remains absconding following the devastating fire at his Arpora nightclub on Saturday night. Activist Tahir Noronha described him as “like a ghost,” saying he rarely stays in Goa and often avoids legal proceedings, sending representatives in his place.

Article Title: Hyderabad Babri Mosque Memorial: 'Babur's reign was very short' Tahreek Muslim Shabban chief plans Babri memorial in Greater Hyderabad; BJP fumes
Article Text:
Murshidabad Tense as Humayun Kabir Faces Heat Over ‘Babri Masjid’ Foundation and Heavy Deployment

HYDERABAD: The president of Tahreek Muslim Shabban, Mushtaq Malik, announced plans to establish a Babri Masjid memorial in Greater Hyderabad, along with welfare institutions, following a public meeting on the mosque's 33rd demolition anniversary on December 7.The announcement has sparked reactions from various political leaders, including BJP National General Secretary Tarun Chugh, who criticized suspended TMC MLA Humayun Kabir's separate initiative to lay the foundation stone for a Babri Masjid in Murshidabad, according to news agency ANI.Malik explained the decision was made during a routine public meeting at a mosque in Hyderabad. "In view of the 33rd anniversary of the demolition of the Babri Masjid, a routine public meeting was held at the mosque in Hyderabad. At that meeting, we decided that a memorial for the Babri Masjid would be built in Greater Hyderabad, and some welfare institutions would also be built within it. We will soon announce how it will be built and for how long," he said.Malik addressed concerns about the mosque's name, dismissing them as political propaganda. "No one should be bothered by the name of Babur. There was no evidence that any revenue came from Babur's side to build the Babri Masjid in Ayodhya.It's possible that some local person was named Babur, but the BJP and the RSS want to make Babur an issue. Babur's reign was very short," he stated.He referenced historical texts to support his argument. "If we look at Tulsidas's Ramayana, it was written 60 years after the construction of the Babri Masjid. There's no mention in that Ramayana that the Ram Temple was demolished," he said.Malik discussed the religious tolerance of subsequent Mughal rulers. "After Babur came Humayun's reign, and after that came Akbar's. There were rituals and prayers in Akbar's palace. Jodha Bai was in Akbar's palace. There were rituals, prayers, and havans... Tulsidas was also alive at that time. During Akbar's period, Tulsidas could have spoken to Akbar. Man Singh was the Chief of the Army at that time. He could have asked him. .. Such a thing doesn't appear in Tulsi Das's Ramayana," he explained.He expressed concern about community division. "So, this is political propaganda to divide the country. The brotherhood that existed between Hindus, Muslims, Sikhs, Christians, and Dalits has been shattered by this, and the seeds of hatred have been sown," he said.In a related development, BJP National General Secretary Tarun Chugh strongly condemned suspended TMC MLA Humayun Kabir's actions in Murshidabad. "The same Babur who came to India aiming to wipe out the country's culture was condemned by Guru Nanak Sahib as a tyrant. He turned the Ganga, Yamuna and Saryu rivers red with Hindu blood. India will never accept any monument or object in his name," Chugh stated.Kabir defended his actions, stating they were constitutional. "Anyone can build a temple, anyone can build a church; I will build a mosque. It is being said that we cannot build the Babri Masjid. It is not written anywhere. The Supreme Court gave a judgement which stated that the Hindu people had demolished the Babri Masjid. Considering the sentiments of Hindus, the decision was taken to build a temple here. Now we see someone laying the foundation stone for a Ram Temple in Sagardighi. But the Constitution allows us to build a mosque," he said.Kabir revealed plans for a 300-crore budget project including a hospital, guesthouse, and meeting hall. He concluded with a declaration: "It is a promise of the Muslims: The Babri Masjid will be built, it will be built, it will be built."
Article Summary: President of Tahreek Muslim Shabban, Mushtaq Malik, announced plans to establish a Babri Masjid memorial in Greater Hyderabad. Announcement has sparked reactions from various political leaders, including BJP National General Secretary Tarun Chugh. Chugh also criticized suspended TMC MLA Humayun Kabir's separate initiative to lay the foundation stone for a 'BabriMasjid'

Article Title: ‘Stand up to ICE’: Zohran Mamdani’s firm message amid Trump's crackdown; releases video on how to handle raids
Article Text:
Zohran Mamdani (Photo credit: AP)

Mamdani Launches First Attack On ICE Agents In NYC After Mayoral Win; 'Out, Out, You're Not...'





New York City’s Mayor-elect Zohran Mamdani released a video explaining the rights of immigrants when confronted by ICE officers, days after a reported US Immigration and Customs Enforcement raid on Canal Street prompted public outcry.In the clip, posted late Sunday, he said, “We can all stand up to ICE if you know your rights,” as he pledged to defend the city’s more than three million immigrant residents. The video accompanied his post on X in which Mamdani wrote: “Know your rights. Protect your neighbours. New York is — and always will be — a city for all immigrants.”Mamdani said he would “protect the rights of every single New Yorker,” stressing that agents “cannot enter into private spaces, like your home, school, or private area of your workplace without a judicial warrant signed by a judge.” He warned that officers may present paperwork “that looks like this and tell you that they have the right to arrest you,” but added, “That is false. ICE is legally allowed to lie to you, but you have the right to remain silent. ”Mamdani also advised that individuals being questioned may ask “Am I free to go?” until they receive a clear answer, and said New Yorkers are allowed to film ICE agents provided they do not interfere with an arrest.“Remain calm. Do not impede their investigation, resist arrest or run,” he added, reiterating that the right to protest remains constitutionally protected.Mamdani, who met President Donald Trump in a surprisingly cordial Oval Office meeting weeks earlier, has positioned himself as a staunch opponent of aggressive immigration enforcement within the city. Closing his video, he said: “New York will always welcome immigrants, and I will fight each and every day to protect, support and celebrate our immigrant brothers and sisters.”His message followed a sequence of enforcement activities that have increased tension in the city. ABC News reported that his advisory was released shortly after federal agents carried out an operation in Manhattan, part of broader immigration enforcement drives across several US cities. The outlet also noted that demonstrators had gathered last weekend as agents attempted detentions on Canal Street, echoing a similar sweep last October that drew spontaneous protests in Chinatown.The New York Times reported that on November 28, protesters clashed with police outside a parking garage on Centre and Hester Streets. Dozens of federal agents from US Customs and Border Protection and the Department of Homeland Security had appeared to be assembling there ahead of a raid. The standoff escalated as protesters blocked the garage entrance with their bodies and piled garbage bags to prevent agents from exiting. The confrontation lasted nearly an hour, leading to several arrests and effectively stalling the operation.
Article Summary: New York City Mayor-elect Zohran Mamdani released a video explaining the rights of immigrants when confronted by ICE officers. In the clip, posted late Sunday, he said, “We can all stand up to ICE if you know your rights,” as he pledged to defend the city's immigrant residents.

Article Title: Who’s on Trump’s ‘Christmas naughty list’? President says it’s 'long'; internet starts guessing
Article Text:
Trump's Speech At National Christmas Tree Lighting Has MAGA Camp Saying The Same Thing





US President Donald Trump dodged a question about his “naughty list,” saying it's a long list and warning that naming names could “start aproblem out there in the world.”When the reporter asked, "Who is on your naughty list, Trump jokingly replied that he had a “long list” before bragging about the United States being “the hottest country in the world. ” He added, “Ooooo… It’s a LONG list! I'd better not tell you, or it’ll cause a problem out there in the world. We've got a pretty big naughty list, but our country is doing well, we'e the hottest country anywhere in the world right, and a year ago we were a dead country,” Trump said.Several users on internet guessing the name for the list but the most common name came was "Adam Schiff."Earlier, the White House has launched a new web page called ‘Offender Hall of Shame’, to expose what they call ‘false and misleading stories’.Story links, news outlet names and information about the journalists who wrote the articles are all detailed on the web portal.Each story is categorised by ‘misrepresentation’, ‘omission of context’, ‘bias’, ‘malpractice’, ‘mischaracterisation’, ‘lie’, ‘false claim’ and even ‘left-wing lunacy’.On Sunday, Trump became the first president in US history to host the Kennedy Center Honors, amid turmoil within the performing arts centre after he removed the president and much of the governing body and installed himself as chairman.Since returning to office in January, Trump had made the John F. Kennedy Center for the Performing Arts, which is named after a Democratic predecessor, a touchstone in a broader attack against what he had lambasted as “woke” anti-American culture. Trump said in August that he had agreed to host the show.At a State Department dinner for the honorees on Saturday, he said he was doing so “at the request of a certain television network.” He predicted that the broadcast, scheduled to air Dec. 23 on CBS and Paramount+, would have its best ratings ever.“It’s going to be something that I believe, and I’m going to make a prediction: This will be the highest-rated show that they’ve ever done and they’ve gotten some pretty good ratings, but there’s nothing like what’s going to happen” on Sunday night, Trump said.He assumed the role that in the past had been held by journalists such as Walter Cronkite and Stephen Colbert, as well as comedians. Before him, presidents watched the show alongside the honorees. Trump skipped the honours altogether during his first term. Since 1978, the honours have recognised stars for their influence on American culture and the arts.This year’s class included Sylvester Stallone for his Rocky and Rambo films, Kiss for its flashy, cartoonish makeup and onstage pyrotechnics, Gloria Gaynor for her feminist anthem I Will Survive, country music superstar George Strait and Tony Award-winning actor Michael Crawford.Stallone said being honoured at the ceremony was like being in the “eye of a hurricane.” The action star stated "This is an amazing event." “But you’re caught up in the middle of it. It’s hard to take it in until the next day. ..: but I’m incredibly humbled by it," he added.Crawford said it was “humbling, especially at the end of a career.”Gaynor said it “feels like a dream” to be honoured. “To be recognized in this way is the pinnacle,” she said on the red carpet.
Article Summary: US President Donald Trump dodged a question about his “naughty list,” saying it’s a long list and warning that naming names could “start aproblem out there in the world” On Sunday, Trump became the first president in US history to host the Kennedy Center Honors, amid turmoil within the performing arts centre.

Article Title: 'If I can't beat him then I shouldn't be ... ': Trump mocks Jimmy Kimmel; calls him 'horrible'
Article Text:
Trump Mocks Kimmel’s ‘Talent’ as He Hosts Kennedy Center Honors in Fiery Oval Office Ceremony





US President Donald Trump on Saturday mocked late-night talk show host Jimmy Kimmel and called him "horrible" while presenting the 2025 Kennedy Center Honours honourees with their medals at the Oval Office.“We have never had a president hosting the awards before. This is the first,” Trump said while addressing reporters, as per Deadline. “I’m sure they’ll give me great reviews, right? You know, they’ll say he was horrible. He was terrible. It was a horrible situation. No, we’ll do fine.”He then compared himself with previous hosts, saying, “I watched some of the people that host. Jimmy Kimmel was horrible, and some of these people. If I can’t beat out Jimmy Kimmel in terms of talent, then I don’t think I should be president.”Trump, who appointed himself chairman of the Kennedy Center in February, said in August that he was “about 98 percent involved” in selecting the honourees. This year’s recipients are Sylvester Stallone , George Strait , KISS, Gloria Gaynor and Michael Crawford.The remarks came amid an ongoing feud between Trump and Kimmel, which escalated when Jimmy Kimmel Live! was suspended for six days in September over comments the host made following Charlie Kirk’s death.During a visit to the United Kingdom, Trump said Kimmel was “fired for lack of talent.”Last month, on Truth Social, he called the host a “man with NO TALENT and VERY POOR TELEVISION RATINGS” and wrote, “Get the bum off the air!!!”Kimmel later addressed the post, saying that his wife told him about Trump’s social media message when he woke up. “I’m the bum. I’m the bum. And he posted this, I think this is interesting, at 12:49 a.m., 11 minutes after the show ended on the East Coast, which is nice,” he teased.
Article Summary: US President Donald Trump mocked late-night talk show host Jimmy Kimmel and called him "horrible" He was presenting the 2025 Kennedy Center Honours honourees with their medals at the Oval Office. The remarks came amid an ongoing feud between Trump and Kimmel, which escalated when Jimmy Kimmel Live! was suspended for six days in September.

Article Title: Israel & Hamas close to 2nd phase of truce: Bibi
Article Text:
A drone view of the lighting up of a Christmas tree in Manger Square outside the Church of the Nativity in Bethlehem in the Israeli-occupied West Bank

Hamas Celebrates As Israel-Backed Militia Leader Yasser Abu Shabab Is Killed In Gaza Clash

Won't quit politics if I get a pardon: Netanyahu





JERUSALEM: Israeli PM Benjamin Netanyahu said the second phase of a US plan to end the war in Gaza was close, but cautioned several key issues still needed to be resolved, including whether a multinational security force would be deployed in the Gaza strip.Netanyahu, speaking to reporters alongside German Chancellor Friedrich Merz, said that he would hold talks with US President Donald Trump at the end of the month on how to ensure the plan's second phase was achieved.The prime minister's office in Nov said that Trump had invited Netanyahu to the White House "in the near future".A Hamas member said Sunday the group is ready to discuss "freezing or storing" its arsenal of weapons as part of its ceasefire with Israel, offering a possible formula to resolve one of the thorniest issues in the agreement. Bassem Naim, a member of Hamas' decision-making political bureau, said, "We are open to have a comprehensive approach in order to avoid further escalations or clashes."A ceasefire between Israel and Hamas is entering its second month, although both sides have accused each other of violating the truce agreement. Netanyahu said that it was important to ensure Hamas not only upholds the ceasefire but also follows through on "their commitment" to the plan to disarm and for Gaza to be demilitarised.According to the plan, Israel is to pull back further in the second phase as a transitional authority is established and a multinational security force is deployed, Hamas is disarmed, and reconstruction begins.A multinational coordination centre has been established in Israel, but there are no deadlines in the plan and officials involved say that efforts to advance it have stalled. "What will be the timeline? What are the forces that are coming in? Will we have international forces? If not, what are the alternatives? These are all topics that are being discussed," Netanyahu said.Merz said that Germany was willing to help rebuild Gaza but would wait for Netanyahu's meeting with Trump, and for clarity on what Washington was prepared to do, before Berlin decides what it would contribute but that phase two "must come now".Netanyahu said on Sunday that he would not retire from politics if he receives a pardon from the president in years-long graft trial.
Article Summary: Israeli PM Benjamin Netanyahu says the second phase of a US plan to end the war in Gaza was close. But he cautioned several key issues still needed to be resolved, including whether a multinational security force would be deployed in the Gaza strip. Netanyahu said he would hold talks with US President Donald Trump at the end of the month.

Article Title: No US visa for fact checkers, content moderators because 'Trump's social media accounts were once locked'
Article Text:
Donald Trump's Stricter H-1B Visa Rule Hits Indian Talent, Background Check Screening Expanded

Which type of fact-checkers, content moderators to be affected





The Donald Trump administration has moved to deny visas to fact-checkers, content moderators who have engaged in "censoring the free speech of US citizens". The State Department has sent a memo to overseas missions this week directing consular officials to deny visas to any applicant "responsible for, or complicit in, censorship or attempted censorship of protected expression in the US", NPR and Reuters reported.A State Department spokesperson told NPR that it was a leaked document but did not deny its authenticity. "The Administration has made clear that it defends Americans' freedom of expression against foreigners who wish to censor them. We do not support aliens coming to the United States to work as censors muzzling Americans," the spokesperson said.The spokesperson emphasized how President Trump's social media accounts were locked and this should not happen to any Americans. “In the past, the President himself was the victim of this kind of abuse when social media companies locked his accounts. He does not want other Americans to suffer this way. Allowing foreigners to lead this type of censorship would both insult and injure the American people," the spokesperson added.Trump's Twitter and Facebook accounts were banned following the January 6 2021, Capitol riot in Washington DC.The memo said there should be enhanced vetting of applicants to see if they have worked in areas that include activities such as "misinformation, disinformation, content moderation, fact-checking, compliance and online safety, among others".The diplomatic officials have been instructed to turn down visa applications from anybody who worked on fact-checking, content moderation of other activities that the Trump administration cnsiders "censorship of Americans' speech".Officials have been asked to scrutinize applicants' work history, LinkedIn profiles, apart from all other social media accounts, looking for mentions in media articles of "activities including combatting misinformation, disinformation or false narratives, content moderation, compliance, and trust and safety".If evidence emerges to indicate to a vetting officer that an individual was engaged in censorship activities, “you should pursue a finding that the applicant is ineligible (for a visa)”, the memo said.
Article Summary: The State Department has sent a memo to overseas missions this week directing consular officials to deny visas to any applicant "responsible for, or complicit in, censorship of protected expression in the US" A State Department spokesperson told NPR that it was a leaked document but did not deny its authenticity. "We do not support aliens coming to the United States to work as censors muzzling Americans," the spokesperson said.

Article Title: FBI addresses Candace Owens’ shocking claim that France hired killers to assassinate her
Article Text:
Candace Owens' claim that French President Macron authorized an assassination plot against her, allegedly involving an Israeli operative, has drawn FBI attention. FBI Director Kash Patel stated the agency investigates all threats, though he offered no evidence to support Owens' theory. Owens has previously suggested conspiracies involving France and Israel.

Kash Patel Accused of Turning FBI Security Detail Into His Girlfriend’s Party Drivers | WATCH

FBI weighs Candace Owens’ explosive claim that France paid for a hit squad to kill her





Candace Owens’ latest accusation has set off a storm bigger than any of her past controversies, pulling in foreign governments, media figures, and now the FBI. The conservative commentator recently claimed that French President Emmanuel Macron authorized an assassination plot targeting her, allegedly involving a team from France’s National Gendarmerie Intervention Group, which she insists includes “one Israeli. ”The accusation was widely mocked online, but it landed on the desk of FBI Director Kash Patel, who was confronted with the claims during a tense interview on The Megyn Kelly Show. While Patel did not validate the theory, his response opened the door to a new level of scrutiny over Owens’ explosive allegations.Last month, Owens posted her original accusation on X, writing that a “high-ranking employee of the French Government” warned her of an assassination order. She claimed, “the Macrons have executed upon and paid for my assassination,” adding that the plot was already “formalized.”She further alleged the hit squad includes “one Israeli” and linked it to the murder of Turning Point USA’s Charlie Kirk, insisting, “The head of state of France apparently wants us both dead.”On Kelly’s show, Patel was asked point-blank whether he believed a foreign government targeted Owens.Patel didn’t support her claim, but he didn’t dismiss it either: “Any American that receives a death threat from overseas or anywhere in America is going to be fully investigated. So we’re not going to turn our eye away from that investigation or any others.”When pressed again, he clarified, “So fa-, we are just looking at everything that comes in… If someone feels that their life is being threatened, we are of course looking at it.”What Patel didn’t provide was evidence. He admitted the FBI has “zero” credible reason to believe foreign governments were behind Kirk’s assassination and offered nothing to support Owens’ theory. Owens, who has repeatedly suggested conspiracies involving France, Israel, and even Kirk’s associates, now finds herself challenged by those she accused, who invited her to a public event to present proof. She accepted, until she didn’t.Whether Owens’ claim is a genuine tip or her most sensational conspiracy yet, Patel’s refusal to outright dismiss it ensures the story won’t fade anytime soon.Also Read: “Provide a description…”: Candace Owens challenges Tim Pool’s shooting claim, demands proof after alleged attack
Article Summary: Conservative commentator Candace Owens claimed French President Emmanuel Macron authorized an assassination plot against her. FBI Director Kash Patel said the agency investigates all threats, though he offered no evidence to support Owens' theory. Owens has previously suggested conspiracies involving France, Israel, and even Charlie Kirk's associates.

Article Title: Who is Oscar Solorzano? Twice deported illegal immigrant charged in Charlotte light rail stabbing case
Article Text: An illegal immigrant, who is identified as Oscar Gerardo Solorzano-Garcia, was taken into custody in connection with a stabbing on a light rail in Charlotte, North Carolina.While investigating the case, the police discovered that the 33-year-old suspect was actually deported twice back to his country.Solorzano-Garcia was issued a final deportation order in 2018 and was removed from the United States on March 9 of that year, DHS said. He was arrested crossing the border illegally again in 2021 and removed a second time. DHS said he apparently re-entered the US a third time at an unknown date and location.DHS Secretary Kristi Noem condemned the alleged stabbing, saying the incident “should have never happened.“This heinous stabbing by this twice removed illegal alien should have NEVER happened. ICE lodged an arrest detainer to ensure Oscar Gerardo Solorzano-Garcia is not released back into North Carolina neighborhoods. Unfortunately, we cannot guarantee the county will honor the detainer since they have a history of not cooperating with ICE,” said Secretary Noem in a press statement released by DHS.“Under President Trump, ICE is being unleashed to ensure public safety for all Americans. Make no mistake: We will not rest until every depraved criminal illegal alien is removed from our communities," she added.What are the charges against him?Oscar Gerardo Solorzano-Garcia has been charged with first-degree murder after allegedly attacking a male passenger with a large knife, according to DHS. ICE said Solorzano-Garcia is in the country illegally.Authorities said Solorzano-Garcia has a criminal history that includes prior arrests for aggravated battery with a deadly weapon, destroying evidence, resisting arrest and using a false ID, as well as convictions for robbery and illegal reentry.
Article Summary: Oscar Gerardo Solorzano-Garcia, 33, has been charged with first-degree murder after allegedly attacking a male passenger with a large knife. He was issued a final deportation order in 2018 and was removed from the United States on March 9 of that year, DHS said. He apparently re-entered the US a third time at an unknown date and location.
